text.b: MACAULAY HONORS PROGRAM AT CUNY BARUCH COLLEGE

text.i: B.B.A., Industrial/Organizational Psychology, GPA 3.7/4.0, full-tuition scholarship

text.b: BRANDEIS UNIVERSITY OFFICE OF HUMAN RESOURCES

page.text: • Provide high level of customer service to visitors to the Employment Relations Office
• Process resumes and I-9 information and conduct phone screenings of potential candidates
• Prepare materials for orientation and conduct orientation for incoming employees
• Update various databases including application flow, HRIS using Microsoft Office and PeopleSoft

text.b: NEW YORK UNIVERSITY CHILD STUDY CENTER

text.i: Summer Program for Kids (SPK) Intern / Recreational Camp Counselor

page.text: • Worked with a team to review and track the progress of 12 children with ADHD aged from 10 to 11
• Conducted one-on-one coaching session to target children’s behaviors using verbal and written daily evaluations
• Processed and maintained confidential clinical reports in the university database
• Consulted clients regarding complications from tax inspection that generated approximately USD 48,000 in fees
• Drafted contracts to be submitted to Tax Managers and Partners before the onboarding of prospective clients
• Performed administrative tasks such as processing and registering tax documents with tax authorities

text.b: LEADERSHIP IN FIGHTING AN EPIDEMIC – GLOBAL AIDS PROGRAM

page.text: • Facilitated discussions during training of practitioners and assessed the progress of the session with supervisors
• Collaborated with Human Resources to review 20 applications during the recruitment cycle of Fall 2010
• Maintained company’s database records and came up with innovative solutions to backlog

text.b: THE VALIDITY OF INFORMATION ON THE INTERNET ABOUT AUTISM

text.i: Research Assistant to Cong Tran Ph.D & Bahr Weiss Ph.D, Vanderbilt University

page.text: • Conduct research into the validity of Vietnamese sources on the Internet regarding Autism
Perform literature reviews on 500+ Vietnamese news, websites articles, and personal blogs detailing the
characteristics, causes, types of treatments, and outcomes of Autism Spectrum Disorders
Plan and code testing variables using qualitative analytic software ATLAS.ti

text.b: ALPHA DELTA PHI FRATERNITY, MIDDLESEX CHAPTER

page.text: • Organize extensive recruitment campaign to recruit prospective members into the organization
• Plan marketing projects by creating clear channels of communication to prospective members
• Host information sessions in Waltham to present different aspects of the organization to prospective members
• Conduct interviews and maintain the recruitment database records to select the most ideal candidates

text.b: INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT GROUP AT BARUCH COLLEGE

text.i: Analyst – Financial Institution Group (FIG) & Equity Research Group

page.text: • Conducted top-down analysis using economic indicators and narrowed down industry-level investing opportunities
• Crafted investment rationales using company’s business model, price performance, and other fundamentals
• Collaborated with industry coverage groups, risk team and financial modeling team to refine investment strategies
• Drafted equity research reports on large and profitable positions in IMG’s simulated and real-money portfolio
• Computer Skills: Proficient in PeopleSoft, Microsoft Office, ATLAS.ti, SPSS, and Java
• Languages: Vietnamese - Native; French - Conversational; Italian – Conversational
